title: Wallace Monument Walk Route

images.title: Bill Harrison / William Wallace Monument
images.caption: "Go back to England and tell them... Scotland is free!"

images.title: Gordon Hatton / Causewayhead from the Wallace Monument
images.caption: Causewayhead from the Wallace Monument. Looking south west over Causewayhead and the River Forth towards Stirling Castle.

images.title: Mike Pennington / Stirling from the Wallace Monument
images.caption: Stirling from the Wallace Monument. The castle overlooks the northern part of the town, with the bridge over the Forth just visible at the bottom left.

description: This walk visits Abbey Craig hill in Stirling, home to the National Wallace Monument which commemorates Sir William Wallace, the 13th-century Scottish Knight. The tower stands on the volcanic crag of Abbey Craig where Wallace is said to have watched the army of King Edward I of England, prior to the Battle of Stirling Bridge. The walk starts at the visitor centre car park and follows good woodland footpaths to the monument where there are wonderful views over Stirling and the River Forth to the Highland Mountains. For a fee you can climb to the top of the monument itself and enjoy even better views. After visiting the monument it's easy to extend your walk into the surrounding woodland on one of the colour coded trails. Just to the north there's the University of Stirling where there are some pleasant grounds to explore. The climb to Dumyat also starts from here.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: To continue your walking around Stirling head to the lovely Plean Country Park. There's woodlands, flower meadows, ponds, streams and the ruined 18th century Plean Country House to explore here. You can also visit the historic sites of Torwood Castle and Tappoch Broch in this area. Head a short distance south west and you can pick up the Stirling Walk which explores the wonderful medieval castle with its fascinating history, beautiful gardens and excellent views. To the south west of Stirling there's a nice circular trail around the picturesque North Third Reservoir to try.

display_address: National Wallace Monument Road, Causewayhead, Stirling, Alba / Scotland, FK9 5LF, United Kingdom
